ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Recovered Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of sudden hearing loss 10 months ago treated with intratympanic steroids, now presenting with normal hearing sensitivity.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports episodic dizziness with nausea occurring twice per week.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional Hearing Difficulties
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Complaints of difficulty hearing in noise and at a distance despite normal audiometric thresholds and speech recognition in quiet.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess current hearing sensitivity following the history of sudden hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and check for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals bilateral hearing sensitivity within normal limits. Speech audiometry demonstrates excellent word recognition bilaterally, consistent with pure-tone thresholds. Tympanometry is normal (Type A) bilaterally. Acoustic reflexes are present and normal at most frequencies, though contralateral reflexes are elevated at 500 Hz bilaterally. Reflex decay is negative.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral thresholds within normal limits (0-15 dB HL) from 250 to 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (RE 5 dB, LE 3 dB) agree with PTA; WRS excellent (96% at 50 dB HL) bilaterally.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral normal 500-4000 Hz; Contralateral normal 1000-4000 Hz but elevated at 500 Hz; Decay negative at 1000 Hz.

counseling_actions: Counseled on Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) options
Counseled on the use of hearing protection in noisy environments

escalation.rationale_short: Patient has recovered hearing but requires assistance with functional listening difficulties (HAT) and routine monitoring.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing sensitivity and functional status.
